availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, saddler. Married to Elizabeth Parker. Father of Julia W. Parker, M. Parker, William R. Parker, and Louise E. Parker. Married to Mary Ann Gardner Parker on April 3, 1854. Father of Alvarado Parker, William R. Parker, Squire E. Parker, Garrett Parker, Gardner Parker, John Parker, and Mary Parker. Saddler in Carter County in 1850. Saddler in Morgan County in 1860. Sergeant and first lieutenant in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from October 1861 to November 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 107.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Morgan County Marriages, p. 135-36.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, West Liberty, p. 2. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0111. Find A Grave, "Andrew Jackson Parker (1823-1908)," Memorial #107754362, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107754362/andrew-jackson-parker (accessed August 12, 2018).
